intro: Chaetogastra cataphracta, commonly known as the broad-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to survive in harsh, rocky environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in crevices or on slopes. The plant is drought-tolerant and can thrive with minimal water, making it well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
